messages.content: ComfyUI-SVDResizer is a helper for resizing the source image according to the sizes enabled in Stable Video Diffusion.
Why does SVDResizer allow changing the image size in steps between 576 and 1024?
The rationale behind allowing size changes in steps between 576 and 1024 is the use of the greatest common denominator of these two numbers, which is 64.
How does adhering to the greatest common denominator rule affect video coherence in SVDResizer?
By adhering to the greatest common denominator rule of 64, the chance of creating a coherent video that is not the standard size of 576x1024 is greater.
What is the recommended way to maintain stability when resizing images using SVDResizer?
It is advisable to keep the value 1024 constant and play with the second size to maintain the stability of the result when using SVDResizer.
What is the purpose of the SVDResizer demo image?
The SVDResizer demo image provides a visual example of how the SVDResizer custom node can be used to resize source images in ComfyUI.
What is the greatest common denominator used in SVDResizer for resizing images?
The greatest common denominator used in SVDResizer for resizing images is 64.
What are the minimum and maximum sizes allowed for image resizing in SVDResizer?
The minimum and maximum sizes allowed for image resizing in SVDResizer are 576 and 1024, respectively.
